front.title: Heuristic discovery of NAT64 and Network-Specific Prefix

abstract.t: Advanced hosts and applications benefit of the knowledge of an IPv6 address, AAAA record, synthesis taking place in the network. This draft describes a method for detecting presence of NAT64 and for learning Network-Specific Prefix used in the access network without support from the access network. The method depends on existence of known IPv4-only domain name. The information learned enables applications and hosts to to perform local IPv6 address synthesis and in some cases avoid NAT64.
